com.ibm.xmi.framework
Interface Extension

All Superinterfaces:
Data
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExtensionImpl
public interface Extension
extends Data

This interface represents an XMI extension. An extension contains XMIObjects and XML elements that do not conform to the metamodel of the object they reside in. They allow you to represent data that doesn't quite map to a particular metamodel.

Each XMI extension has an extender and an extenderID. The extender can be used to identify the tool that created the extension. The extenderID can be used either to provide a tool-specific ID for the extension, or to label the extension in some way.

The framework will automatically create extensions for you if you use sets of tag values for XMI objects. You should use this class only if you want to create your own extensions.

You can use the XMLElementImpl class to create your own XML elements to put into extensions; XMI allows any XML elements to be put in extensions.

public void add(Data d)
You should add XMI objects and XML elements to an extension; the framework does not prevent you from adding other constructs, though.
Parameters:
d - XMI data

getXMIContents

public java.util.Collection getXMIContents()
Return the XML elements and XMI objects directly contained in this extension. If there are none, an empty collection is returned; otherwise, an unmodifiable collection of XML elements and XMI objects is returned.
Returns:
An empty collection or an unmodifiable collection of XML elements and objects.
